bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Thomas W. H. Rolleston, [?] [?] 1885?
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: I am in my little old house I told you about, not far from the river. Health pretty fair the last four months, & would be so still, except for an increasing prostration of the whole muscular system, connected somehow with a head derangement,—almost a falling sickness, as at times I cannot keep my legs. Mental arrangements go on untouched—am busy at a preface, prose of course, to completed L of G.—to an edition same plates as the 1881–2 one—have scribbled one or two reminiscences (life sketches of notable men) which I will send you when printed—
May be necessary for me to give the German publisher a formal copyright waiver and warranteewarranty, which I will do. I am sole owner and controlercontroller of all L of G copyrights here.
Soon as you begin print—send me specimen proofs of some of the pages—
